DOC.brief_summary: Background : - Researchers National Institutes Health give many test hear balance . These test help detect problem affect hear balance . It important know exactly healthy people perform test . This information indicate test result normal test result show problem . Researchers also want determine best method test . Objectives : - To test different type hear balance test , collect information normal value test . Eligibility : - Healthy volunteer 5 70 year age . Design : - This study require single visit National Institutes Health Clinical Center . It include screen test study test hear balance . Sometimes , second visit may require test design measure thing 2 different day . Each visit last 2 5 hour , depend number test schedule per visit . - Participants physical exam medical history . They also basic test check normal hearing balance . - Participants may different hearing test , include follow : - Auditory Evoked Potentials study ear brain handle sound information . - Auditory Processing Tests study person process complex sound like speech background noise . - Tests middle ear inner ear function . - Participants may different balance inner ear test , include follow : - Balance test tilt platform . - Different test measure well eyes , ear , brain work together help maintain balance . - Treatment need part study .
DOC.detailed_description: Objective : This normative data collection protocol . The primary objective establish normative range data NIH research population test auditory vestibular function employ parameter and/or methodology either new unique NIH , upgrade ( software and/or hardware ) , well standardized literature . Use normative data two-fold : 1 ) serve reference interval normal performance test result interpret normal abnormal , case 2 ) use control data purpose comparison data obtain various patient group . Secondary objective , applicable , evaluate : 1 ) effect change methodology , stimulus characteristic , test equipment , test paradigm normative data exist measure , 2 ) influence subject age gender normative data , 3 ) intra-subject variability repeat measure . This protocol provide construct small , targeted normative study , subsequently , specific priori hypothesis . Study population : Healthy volunteer range age 5-80 year study protocol . Design : This protocol design collect normative data test audiometric vestibular function . Small sub-studies conduct healthy volunteer order determine normal distribution performance define subset hear and/or balance test . These sub-studies fall one follow five general category : serial monitoring auditory function , auditory evoked potential , auditory processing , middle ear function , vestibular function . All participant basic hear test tympanometry confirm eligibility protocol . The subsequent measure auditory vestibular function depend define subset test normative data seek . Possible test normal data collection would include : middle ear function test ( MEF ) , otoacoustic emission ( OAE ) , auditory evoke potential ( AEP ) , test auditory processing ( AP ) , computerized dynamic platform posturography ( CDPP ) , vestibular evoke myogenic potential ( VEMP ) , videonystagmography ( VNG ) and/or rotational vestibular testing ( RVT ) . The selection test sub-study determine either need establish control data patient population currently evaluate collaborative protocol , establish normative data test expand ability investigate specific pathology/function equivalent publish normative data available ( e.g. , otolith disease , auditory processing disorder ) . The specific test participant perform clearly indicate described consent/assent document explain consent/assent process . Testing conduct single outpatient clinic visit exception measure test-retest reliability investigate . Outcome measure : This normative data collection protocol design describe normal behavioral physiologic auditory vestibular function NIH research population . Outcome measure vary test test include one following : 1 ) response threshold , amplitude , latency , velocity , frequency response , and/or accuracy , 2 ) number and/or percent correct , 3 ) response repeatability , 4 ) interaural response difference .
DOC.criteria: INCLUSION CRITERIA : Healthy adult volunteer : Healthy adult , age 1880 year Able provide inform consent Normal hearing sensitivity , define puretone threshold less equal 25 dB HL , puretone threshold exceeds 25 dB HL , must less equal median threshold appropriate gender agebased group , 2508000 Hz ( Morrell et al , 1996 , ISO7029 , 2000 ) . No airbone gap excess 10 dB 5004000 Hz . Normal middle ear function indicate normal 226 Hz tympanograms bilaterally , define middle ear pressure le 100 decaPascals , peak compensate static compliance 0.31.5 milliliter ( Margolis & Heller , 1987 ) American English first language participate auditory processing substudy . Able refrain caffeine alcohol 48 hour vestibular study session agent may modify test result EXCLUSION CRITERIA : History auditory and/or vestibular disorder ( e.g. , Meniere syndrome , labyrinthitis ) . Evidence active outer middle ear disease anomaly ( e.g . otitis medium , stenotic ear canal , otorrhea ) History chronic ( fluid middle ear 4 month ) recurrent otitis medium ( 4 episode acute otitis medium one year ) History ear surgery PE tube Current PE tubes History treatment ototoxic medication ( e.g . cisplatin , aminoglycoside antibiotic ) Unable discontinue medication interfere vestibular test result 48 hour immediately precede vestibular study session . These include antidizziness medication ( Antivert ) , prescription pain medication ( Percocet ) , prescription headache medication ( Imitrex ) , sleep pill ( Ambien ) , antiseizure medication ( Topamax ) , and/or antihistamine ( Benadryl ) . Current diagnosis Diagnostic Statistical Manual Mental Disorders ( DSM IV ) psychiatric disorder medication psychiatric disorder past two year , include antidepressant , anxiolytic , psychostimulant drug . Cognitive impairment evidence standard score le 85 Peabody Picture Vocabulary Test ( Fourth Edition ) ( Dunn Dunn , 2007 ) Attention deficit hyperactivity disorder ( ADHD ) evidence score great equal 4 Adult ADHD Self Report Scale ( Kessler et al. , 2005 ) . History diagnosis central nervous system disorder , include limited : Intracranial tumor Cerebrovascular disease Degenerative CNS disorder CNS trauma Encephalitis Meningitis Current diagnosis speech and/or language disorder , autism , auditory neuropathy , auditory processing disorder ; therapy disorder past 2 year . Visual ocular motor impairment prevent ability see accurately follow visual target use calibration and/or ocular motor task participate vestibular substudies . These include antidizziness medication ( Antivert ) , prescription pain medication ( Percocet ) , prescription headache medication ( Imitrex ) , sleep pill ( Ambien ) , antiseizure medication ( Topamax ) , and/or antihistamine ( Benadryl ) . Current diagnosis Diagnostic Statistical Manual Mental Disorders ( DSM IV ) psychiatric disorder medication psychiatric disorder past two year , include antidepressant , anxiolytic , psychostimulant drug .
